abstract: Fall from a standing height onto an outstretched arm , assess for new versus old fracture , date of injury DATE , ulnar sided hand pain .
pls: Fall from a standing height onto an outstretched arm , assess for new versus old fracture , date of injury DATE , ulnar sided hand pain .
gen: This is an update of an earlier version of this post.

abstract: None Coronal T2 , STIR and 3-D GRE , axial T1 and STIR , sagittal T2 and STIR sequence imaging is performed through the right hand without contrast .
pls: None Coronal T2 , STIR and 3-D GRE , axial T1 and STIR , sagittal T2 and STIR sequence imaging is performed through the right hand without contrast .
gen: This is an updated version of an earlier version of this review.

abstract: There is an intramedullary lesion involving the fifth metacarpal .
pls: There is an intramedullary lesion involving the fifth metacarpal .
gen: This is a rare condition of the fifth metacarpal.

abstract: The fracture extends approximately 4 cm in length with bright T2 and intermediate T1 signal .
pls: The fracture extends approximately 4 cm in length with bright T2 and intermediate T1 signal .
gen: The fracture is a small, short-lived fracture that is thought to be caused by a single fracture. The fracture is about 4 cm in length with bright T2 and intermediate T1 signal.

abstract: There is endosteal scalloping and minimal expansion .
pls: There is endosteal scalloping and minimal expansion .
gen: There is no evidence to support the existence of a new species.

abstract: The findings are consistent with an enchondroma .
pls: The findings are consistent with an enchondroma .
gen: The findings are consistent with an enchondroma.

abstract: There appears be a nondisplaced pathologic fracture through the enchondroma with cortical disruption noted near the junction of the middle and distal thirds of the fifth metacarpal shaft with minimal adjacent periostitis .
pls: There appears be a nondisplaced pathologic fracture through the enchondroma with cortical disruption noted near the junction of the middle and distal thirds of the fifth metacarpal shaft with minimal adjacent periostitis .
gen: This is a non-fractured fracture of the fifth metacarpal muscle of the enchondroma.

abstract: Mild tenosynovitis of the fourth and fifth flexor tendon sheaths .
pls: Mild tenosynovitis of the fourth and fifth flexor tendon sheaths .
gen: Mild tenosynovitis of the fourth and fifth flexor tendon sheaths.

abstract: The flexor and extensor tendons are otherwise normal .
pls: The flexor and extensor tendons are otherwise normal .
gen: The flexor and extensor tendons are otherwise normal.

abstract: The osseous structures of the right hand are otherwise normal .
pls: The osseous structures of the right hand are otherwise normal .
gen: The osseous structures of the right hand are otherwise normal.

abstract: The musculature of the right hand is normal .
pls: The musculature of the right hand is normal .
gen: The musculature of the right hand is normal.

abstract: There is an intramedullary lesion of the fifth metacarpal shaft measuring approximately 2.4 cm in length .
pls: There is an intramedullary lesion of the fifth metacarpal shaft measuring approximately 2.4 cm in length .
gen: This is a small lesion of the fifth metacarpal shaft measuring approximately 2.4 cm in length.

abstract: The appearance is most typical of an enchondroma and radiographic correlation is advised .
pls: The appearance is most typical of an enchondroma and radiographic correlation is advised .
gen: This is a picture of an enchondroma, a type of cystoscopy.

abstract: There is a nondisplaced transverse fracture involving the fifth metacarpal near the junction of the middle and distal thirds of the metacarpal shaft with minimal adjacent periostitis representing a pathologic fracture .
pls: There is a nondisplaced transverse fracture involving the fifth metacarpal near the junction of the middle and distal thirds of the metacarpal shaft with minimal adjacent periostitis representing a pathologic fracture .
gen: This is a fracture of the fifth metacarpal near the junction of the middle and distal thirds of the shaft with minimal adjacent periostitis representing a pathologic fracture.

abstract: There is adjacent soft tissue edema and this appears to represent an acute injury .
pls: There is adjacent soft tissue edema and this appears to represent an acute injury .
gen: There is a small amount of bleeding on the surface of the back of the leg and this appears to represent an acute injury.

abstract: Minimal tenosynovitis fourth and fifth digit flexor tendon sheaths .
pls: Minimal tenosynovitis fourth and fifth digit flexor tendon sheaths .
gen: Minimal tenosynovitis fourth and fifth digit flexor tendon sheaths.
